946501526402535424.full_text:
#OnThisDay 28/12/1937 Snowfall in Nanjing. Minnie Vautrin begins registering the Safety Zone refugees. Studying the men’s faces, she realizes they are mainly “the old, the maimed, the halt, for all young men who could do so have gone west.”
#WWII #China #NanjingMassacre #抗日戰爭

946841328767393792.full_text: In 1937 John Magee filmed the #NanjingMassacre, when 300,000 people were killed by Japanese troops.  still largely unknown in the West https://t.co/x40F6kgkNg

946931936311873536.full_text: 'There is a core of inexplicable horror attached to events such as the Nanjing massacre.' Author Peter Harmsen quoted by @SCMP_News on the tragedy 80 years ago. #China #Japan #WW2 #nanjingmassacre https://t.co/DRTGdkQXM7 https://t.co/KjoMnlYM4O

945910852837715975.full_text: #OnThisDay 26/12/1937 As the Japanese set up a military bordello, John Rabe records a respected Red Swastika Society member calling forth several young girls—former prostitutes—to identify themselves amongst the refugees and volunteer their services. #WWII #NanjingMassacre
